subject: When Winning Is Losing
event: Life is magical and full of... No.  Sorry.  I can't do it. The Giants and the Jets both won today.  The G-Men won a convincing victory over the Potomac Drainage Basin Indigenous Peoples, despite RGIII coming off the bench to play pretty well.  Eli looked good, and Odell Beckham Junior continued to look great.  The Jets won a wafer-thin victory over a truly awful Tennessee Titans team (hate that name, they should be the Nashville Cats), the same squad that the Giants crushed just last week... and even then, they almost blew it with one second left when the Titans tried one of those dipsy-doodle seven-lateral plays and came within seven yards of the winning TD.  Even in victory, Geno Smith looked awful. But it's hard to feel great about either win.  The season is over for both teams.  No one is going to the playoffs.  Lots of people will be getting fired at year's end.   Big Blue and Gang Green weren't even acting as spoilers; their opponents have awful records too.   The Giants at least had the satisfaction of beating a division rival.  The Jets?  Not so much.  No rivalry there.  The Jets are awful, the Titans are awfuller.  And by winning, the Jets dropped behind the Titans and four other teams in the draft, meaning their chances of getting Oregon's Heismann-winning quarterback just got a lot worse.  That's the Jets for you.  Even when they win, they lose. The only real highlight of the day was the continued superlative play of Giants rookie wideout Odell Beckham Junior.  The G-Men have had a number of good receivers over the years, but they have not had a GREAT one since...  well, ever.  (Okay, maybe Homer Jones, but he was a long time ago).

comments.article: I knew the Jets would go and win just enough games to put themselves out of contention for a great QB. At least we can look at the potential of the Giants next year, with several strong receivers, we just need to strengthen the lines.
comments.subject: No surprise...

comments.article:
I've been a Raiders fan for 30 years. The last time the Raiders won the big game was 31 years ago. The last time we had a true winning season was 12 years ago. Being a Raiders fan is like being in love with a crack-addict. My head knows it is wrong, but my heart wants to believe. It's like my favorite character, Theon. Tortured in nightmarish conditions until we eventually get sold to Los Angeles.

There there, GRRM. I feel your pain.
comments.subject: Pain

comments.article:
I don't know whether to offer my condolences or sympathies on the season, but I can thank your G-Men for at least one thing. OBJr got me into my fantasy championship game.

So there's that.

Sorry for your Jets, too.
comments.subject: Sorry, but thanks

comments.article: ...so I see you're a Gregg Easterbrook reader.
comments.subject: Aha...

comments.article:
they should be the Nashville Cats

I lobbied hard for the Tennessee Tuxedos, but only if they had a walrus wearing a bowler as the mascot. Yes, I'm old.

My Tampa Bay Buccaneers gave me quite the scare today: we almost beat the Carolina Panthers. Kind of.

Much better to lose out now, get that #1 pick, and take Mariota.

Do you think the Jets will have any interest in Winston if he is available when the Jets pick, George?
comments.subject: Suck for the Duck

comments.article: The Jets may.  I don't.
comments.subject: Re: Suck for the Duck

comments.article: You guys should just lose the armour and switch to Rugby.  In a man's game you lose some teeth, you bloody your shirt, you bend your nose.  You play it.  You play Ruuuuugby.  Ahh.
comments.subject: Rugby

comments.article:
Scientific studies disagree. NFL players hit much harder & cause far more severe and permanent damage. So, in that regard, your idea might be better... seeing as the "armor" is a great contributor to the greater violence of the sport.

Rugby & footy players appear to hit hard and they definitely cause superficial damage more often than NFL players, but because they are aware of their mortality outside of the "armor," their actual impacts are minor compared to every play in the NFL. Granted, rugby & footy players have a much higher rate of spinal injuries. This is likely because American football players, from an early age, are taught to not use their heads like a spear. It still happens, but not as often as in rugby.
comments.subject: Re: Rugby

comments.article: better fired than stabbed to death by a circle of their peers
Bah hahaha! Perfect.

comments.upictitle: ryan, diesel, ty johnson, dirk vargas, ect.. ect..: Syd
comments.article: When sportscasters and pundits say "you couldn't make this up!" or "you couldn't write that ending!" do you ever think to yourself "Wanna bet?"

The record for 1st round picks of QBS are crap shoots. Montana in the 3rd round, Brady in the 6th. Remember how sad everyone was when Rodgers was not picked until Green Bay took him in the late 1st round. Now I read he is waking up with Olivia Munn. I do not feel to sorry for him now. But that Oregon kid sure looks good.
comments.subject: First round pick QBs

comments.article:
It's unfortunate that Frank Wycheck didn't suit up for one more "backward lateral", as that last play by the Flaming Thumbtacks had me thinking Music City Miracle for an instant.

Best of luck to the Jets in the Marcus Mariota sweepstakes.
comments.subject: Gregg Easterbrook would be proud...

comments.article: Root for the Patsâ€¦ you'll feel better most of the time.
But the Pats are evil.

comments.upictitle: tafkarfanfic: Me: I'm not full of virtues
comments.article:
Potomac Drainage Basin Indigenous Peoples
This is hilarious.
Yes... but not original.  Borrowed from Tuesday Morning QUarterback at ESPN.com

I love coming to your blog to read any single tidbit I can get about GOT & the books, what you are up to & your football comments! I'm a fellow New Jerseyian & football fanatic. As a lifelong Giants fan & Jets follower I'm so over this season and looking forward to 2015 esp to see what Cruz & OBjr can do. The Raider's fan put into words exactly how I feel as a Knicks fan! And I had to have a giggle with myself last year when you were positively commenting on the Jets & praising a certain player on a game, my boyfriend at the time. We are still good friends. I just had to tell him how I got a kick of how my favorite author was blogging of how such a fan he was of my bf. I gave him your feedback personally, lol!

There's always next year! :-/

Jersey Love GRRM!
comments.subject: The end of our season...

comments.article: I have Green Bay and New England in a rematch with the Patriots coming out on top!
comments.subject: Who is your favorite to win the Superbowl?

comments.article:
My dream Superbowl would be Giants and Jets.

My nightmare Superbowl would be Cowboys versus Patriots. Which does have a slim chance of happening this year. I hope not. I'd have to root for an asteroid to hit the earth.

I would have said Packers had a good chance, but Buffalo cleaned their clocks today. Right now, I'd say it looks like Seattle against New England, in which case I am cheering for Seattle.
comments.subject: Re: Who is your favorite to win the Superbowl?
Re: Who is your favorite to win the Superbowl?
Re: Who is your favorite to win the Superbowl?

comments.article: In a couple of weeks, the Dolphins will be happy to contribute to a more losing season for the Jets so they can grab a better draft pick :-> (We, of course, got mauled by the Patriots today so our season is over too, and we're too middle-of-the-road to get any sort of draft position.)

Heh... You think rooting for New York is bad? I'm a Titans fan. Since Jeff Fisher left, we've slowly but surely turned into something pathetic. If any team needs an all-out overhaul after these past few years, it is us. Whisenhunt should be fired; Locker/Mettenburger should be benched; our defense replaced with a brick wall 10 foot high with faces drawn onto it to fool Roger Goodell; the whole shebang.
comments.subject: The Titans

comments.article:
It could be worse. You could be a Nashville resident and obligated by geography to root for the Titans on all days when they're not playing the Saints.

I imagine Ann Patchett wearily cooking hot dogs on a portable grill outside the stadium, knowing that those season tickets meant nothing but pain.
Did you watch the Eagles Cowboys game? How did Dez Bryant get that wide open? At least Bradley Fletcher is not your starting Cornerback.
comments.subject: NFL: Eagles Secondary

comments.article:
Possible Giants could just be following the same script en route to another Superbowl win next year?

They'll be entering the year where they play the AFC East during the regular season. They'll start off strong, go through a horrible stretch mid season, rebound at the end of the season and get hot going into the playoffs (and play two epic games against the Patriots and Jets along the way).

In the playoffs, they'll beat the Packers in Lambeu in a freezing cold game and we'll see the return of pink face Tom Coughlin. Superbowl will be against the Patriots of course and will go down to the wire with Oberyn Beckham making a spectacular catch that rivals Manningham and Tyree. Giants pull it off in the end, Eli is the MVP, Coughlin retires and rides off into the sunset.

A guy can dream can't he?
comments.subject: Wishful thinking?

comments.article: I like the way you think.
comments.subject: Re: Wishful thinking?

comments.article: If things don't change, tough personal decisions need to be made.  It's too painful.  I'm already Irish Catholic.  The self-abuse is piling so high it threatens to topple over awash the innocents.  The recurring optimism met by inevitable disappointment is akin to Sunday mornings as a kid.  One minute you're eating pancakes and watching cartoons, happy as a clam; the next you're wearing blisters into your OshKosh-covered knees, hearing about eternal damnation.  Where is our one true king?  This winter has lasted 45 years.
comments.subject: I'm with you, brother.

comments.article:
That sound you heard during the Jets game was the Oregon QB cheering his butt off for the Jets. After Sanchez, after Geno, why would they throw another first rounder to the lions? I think they should just bring back Vinnie. Or Ray Lucas. Or Kliff Kingsbury.

Joffrey would totally be a Patriots fan. Stannis: Colts fan until they left Baltimore. Ned Stark: Packers. Jon Snow: Bears (but secretly Packers). Little Finger: Cowboys season ticket holder, but will bet against them given a favorable line. Sansa: Rams (pretty uniforms). Ramsay Snow: Raiders. Theon Greyjoy: Raiders (formerly Seahawks). Jorah Mormont: Bills (always the pretender). Tormond Giantsbane: Alouettes. The Tyrells: Dolphins. The Martells: more into jai alai. Hodor: Hodor.
comments.subject: jets

comments.article: Ravens ftw!!

Playoffs out of the question and no good EXplanation for dropping down in the draft. Five teams ahead of the Jets now, no chance for Mariota to play for the once great Jets. Sad days all around.

A question for you Good Ser, I have been re reading Wild Cards Deuces Down and was wondering if by chance you based the Great and Powerful Turtle off of the 1974 Giants Centre Bob Hyland. Thank you Ser, and have a merry christmas.
comments.subject: Playoff dreams dashed.

comments.article: Convert to being a Saints fan :) Our season has been garbage but we Voodoo'd the crap out of our division so we will (hopefully) make the playoffs. Your NY boys need to work on their blood magic.
comments.subject: Playoffs
